name: VTS
slogan: Every asset. Every opportunity. One platform
description: Founded with a mission to revolutionize commercial real estate through innovation, VTS is the industry's leading leasing and asset management platform. By centralizing all of their critical data and workflows in one place, VTS empowers landlords and brokers to better attract, convert and retain their most valuable asset – tenants. Over 7 billion square feet is managed on the VTS platform by a user base exceeding 28,000. The firm's client roster comprises global commercial real estate leaders including Boston Properties, Beacon Capital Partners, Equity Office, LaSalle Investment Management, Hines, JLL and CBRE.

jobs.title: Contract Real Estate Photo, Video, and 3D Creatives
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help VTS Succeed:

We are a tightly-knit team looking for reliable and talented individuals to capture photos, video and 3D content for commercial (office) properties.  We will be serving NYC locations (mostly Manhattan but also the outer boroughs), and soon the rest of the tri-state area.

We are looking for freelance Photographers, Videographers, and Matterport Scan Techs with previous experience in real estate.  If you are proficient in all 3 types of content, that’s a bonus.  If you have experience shooting commercial office space that’s a bonus as well, but residential-only experience is OK as well.
For those who do great work for us and enjoy working on our team, we can offer longer-term commitments of 5+ days/month guaranteed work.  We’re going to have A LOT to cover and will want to create a highly dependable, efficient team.


What Makes You Awesome for This Role:
- **Photography:** 
- Experience shooting spaces with challenging lighting conditions (high contrast, mixed color temperatures, etc)
- Ability to pay close attention to our shoot guide.  Everyone on our team must be shooting the same style and coverage.
- Full frame DSLR or mirrorless camera with high-quality wide-angle lens(es).
- **Videography:** 
- Experience covering spaces in a very functional way, rather than in a highlight/flashy style.
- A high level of control over stabilized camera movement, using electronic stabilizers/gimbals.
- **Matterport 3D Scans:** 
- You must be scanning with the Pro2 camera/scanner
- You understand the importance of specific scan placements and can adjust your existing scan strategies to accommodate our shoot guide.
- You understand the limitations of the Matterport platform, and know how to navigate them in various types of spaces.
  


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Data Research Analyst
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help VTS Succeed
In this role, you will join a Data Insights Product Team. You will translate data into actionable insights and data products including, a market intelligence platform and research reports.


Responsibilities
- Responsible for drawing insight from our data, and other sources to identify, locate and analyze specific commercial real estate industry trends at both the market level and the individual property/portfolio level
- Develop data-driven analytical platforms and reporting commercial solutions
- Conduct on-going data quality work, and define improvement in the data collection process 
- Analyzing large amounts of data, creating algorithms, dashboards, visualizations, and business tools
- Develop deep domain expertise on our datasets, the underlying process and behaviors through these datasets and relationships with measurable economic phenomena and market trends
- Utilize data analysis techniques to derive meaningful insights that the end users can clearly act on to drive their business results


What Makes This Job Awesome
- Analyzing and enriching a diverse range of structured and unstructured data into datasets for analysis
- Analyzing large amounts of data to create actionable insights
- Developing deep domain expertise on our unique and valuable datasets
- Enjoy analyzing large amounts of data to create actionable insights


What Makes You Awesome for Data Insights Team
- Experience managing and analyzing (Commercial Real Estate) CRE market data is greatly preferred
- Ability to handle large datasets and have strong quantitative skills
- Strong analytical aptitude and excellent communication skills
- Familiar with technical concepts, research concepts, and analysis
- Strong research background, computer skills, and attention to detail required
- A bachelor’s degree or a master degree preferably in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Real Estate, Operations Research or a related discipline


What VTS Values & How We Show It
- **Strive for Excellence** - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
- **Be Customer Obsessed** - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious** - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
- **Move as One** - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
- **Take Ownership** - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
- **Appreciate the Difference** - VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Head of Market Research
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Our mission is to be Commercial Real Estate’s modern operating system, the place where deals happen, customer relationships are nourished, and real-time market data comes to life. We're growing at an incredible pace and are looking for a talented Head of Market Research to join the team.

Our Head of Market Research will lead VTS’ research that will differentiate VTS, build and maintain a competitive advantage in the marketplace through market expertise, analysis, and insight. Your responsibilities will be to track and analyze the commercial real estate market with a focus on data collection, presentation, financial analysis. You will work closely with external research colleagues, brokerage professionals and clients.  This role will also work in close collaboration with our Product team to ensure that we are constantly innovating the VTS solution and being the spokesperson for our clients and prospects. 


WHAT YOU'LL DO
- Responsible for collecting, analyzing and creating content of actionable, commercial insights through presentations, whitepapers and other output that positions VTS as the dominant voice in the industry and market
- May provide content support to leadership in order to assist in representing VTS’ perspectives on property and market dynamics in a specific sector or geography.
- Communicate data excellence and insights via traditional reporting products and the use of advanced data visualization tools
- Partner with brokerage leaders to contribute to business development efforts and grow the business
- Contribute to client presentations by covering market intelligence, trends, and statistics
- Acts as an active participation to support new business development initiatives
- Keep track and inform brokerage leaders of local and national commercial real estate news
- Provides analytical and collection support for global, regional and local research initiatives as needed
- Must be responsive to multiple internal and external constituencies—sales professionals, management, media, real estate associations, clients—by providing relevant insights on market conditions and trends.


ABOUT YOU
- Bachelor’s degree and 7+ years professional experience 
- Demonstrated passion in real estate with a strong commitment to learning micro- and macro-level market dynamics
- Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.
- Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in complex situations. Requires strong analytical and quantitative skills.
- Must have a commercial mindset. Able to identify trends and think about the market in innovative ways. Can translate ideas into thoughtful deliverables that differentiate VTS, our professionals and our products.
- A strong understanding of research fundamentals. Knowledge of how to apply research and data analytics expertise to benefit our brand and core businesses.
- Strong quantitative skill-set with ability to identify new insights and trends through data analytics
- Collaborative attitude and willingness to both work independently and as part of a dynamic team
- Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to clients
- Ability to effectively prepare information for presentation by others at events and to clients.
- Team player. Able to work across Marketing, PR, Research, Operations and local and national leadership to achieve collective goals and create exponential results.
- Can oversee multiple projects or assigned project tasks, determine priorities and develop a through-line to completion, including harnessing the right resources and collaborating along the way
  


We Take Care of You! 
- Competitive compensation packages, including equity
- Great medical, vision, dental, and commuter benefits
- Generous family policies
- Training and career development programs for everyone in the company
- 401K plan
- Unlimited vacation policy
- Team lunches, company happy hours, ample snacks and drinks
- VTS clubs including rock climbing, skiing, baking, board-games, surfing, softball and more


#LI-JS1


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Implementation Coordinator, truva
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help truva Succeed:

As Implementation Coordinator, you will be joining the truva Implementation team, responsible for ensuring the successful rollout of truva - both data onboarding and content creation coordination - for our clients. We shape our clients’ first impressions using the truva platform to power their businesses and strive to offer an excellent experience for every client.

You will be supporting both clients and internal teams with onboarding customer data onto the truva platform. As our company scales, the responsibilities outlined below may expand or evolve to adapt along with the truva product suite and our clients’ increasing adoption of the platform across their businesses. Adapting your approach to support our clients’ needs over time will be paramount to success in this role. 

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 


What Makes This Job Awesome:
- **Being Client Success Driven:**
- Work cross-functionally across teams at truva to ensure a consistent client experience from pre-sale through to implementation and ongoing support for each onboarded client and broker
- Collaborate directly with professionals within each client to confirm goals driving implementation of VTS at their organization and tailor data collection (automation where possible) and best-practice communication to those goals 
- Using a lens for long-term client success and data completeness within VTS,
- Ensure all key data is collected and entered as part of implementation to support data continuity as the client adopts new workflows within VTS - be comfortable challenging clients that push back on providing complete datasets
- Facilitate change management for client's business processes that will be managed within VTS after implementation
- Be comfortable challenging clients on existing processes to help optimize their process and project
- **Running a Tight (Project) Ship:**
- Plan, schedule, and manage project timeline and activities from project kick-off through portfolio go live to ensure each project is delivered on time, within budget, and satisfies the desired outcomes of truva implementation
- Mitigate project risks by setting clear expectations with the client up front and proactively communicating project concerns to team leadership and project sponsors
- Plan and facilitate regular, recurring project touch points to ensure clients are providing quality, complete data within expected timelines to support best practice adoption and timely-go-live
- Manage all pre-production stages of content (photo,video,3D) generation:
- Work with client leasing teams to determine the scope of truva shoots at each property
- Develop a shoot scheduling game plan across the client portfolio, taking into consideration building access, weather, space priority and content partner availability
- Work with truva content partners to deploy 3D scan & video technicians on property
- Confirm final content is attached to corresponding listings and ready for client review 
- **Working to Scale:**
- Implement repeatable, automated data collection and onboarding processes that scale for the truva implementation team and support client outcomes
- Optimize for automation where possible, while still reducing post-go-live data changes via implementation of a standardized UAT process 
- Document relevant implementation details (work-arounds where needed, etc) and client-specific workflows and best-practices for reference both by the client and ongoing support teams
- Regularly reflect on and share project learnings with the implementation team with an eye for continuously improving processes to better serve our clients and team


What Makes You Awesome For This Role:
- 1 + years of experience in the enterprise software space working directly with clients and partners to complete rollouts
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, experience with client-facing presentations and have a consistent record of working with senior leaders
- You work with end-goals in mind and are excited about helping clients achieve their goals at all levels
- You have a proven record of creating and maintaining project plans, monitoring open issues, and driving resolutions
- You see problems are opportunities and are motivated to break down issues in order to implement solutions quickly
- Comfortable with escalation management
- You are able to build consultative relationships with client stakeholders at all levels and have working experience interacting with cross-functional teams
- You are a master at change management - you guide others toward new behaviors through understanding and communication
- Nice to haves: 
- Working experience with tracking systems such as JIRA and Zendesk
- An understanding of how APIs work, SQL, and software troubleshooting


What VTS Values & How We Show It
- **Strive for Excellence** - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
- **Be Customer Obsessed -** We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious** - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
- **Move as One** - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
- **Take Ownership** - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
- **Appreciate the Difference** - VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes. We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com. Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help truva Succeed:

As Implementation Coordinator, you will be joining the truva Implementation team, responsible for ensuring the successful rollout of truva - both data onboarding and content creation coordination - for our clients. We shape our clients’ first impressions using the truva platform to power their businesses and strive to offer an excellent experience for every client.

You will be supporting both clients and internal teams with onboarding customer data onto the truva platform. As our company scales, the responsibilities outlined below may expand or evolve to adapt along with the truva product suite and our clients’ increasing adoption of the platform across their businesses. Adapting your approach to support our clients’ needs over time will be paramount to success in this role.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

What Makes This Job Awesome:

  • Being Client Success Driven:
  • Work cross-functionally across teams at truva to ensure a consistent client experience from pre-sale through to implementation and ongoing support for each onboarded client and broker
  • Collaborate directly with professionals within each client to confirm goals driving implementation of VTS at their organization and tailor data collection (automation where possible) and best-practice communication to those goals
  • Using a lens for long-term client success and data completeness within VTS,
  • Ensure all key data is collected and entered as part of implementation to support data continuity as the client adopts new workflows within VTS - be comfortable challenging clients that push back on providing complete datasets
  • Facilitate change management for client's business processes that will be managed within VTS after implementation
  • Be comfortable challenging clients on existing processes to help optimize their process and project
  • Running a Tight (Project) Ship:
  • Plan, schedule, and manage project timeline and activities from project kick-off through portfolio go live to ensure each project is delivered on time, within budget, and satisfies the desired outcomes of truva implementation
  • Mitigate project risks by setting clear expectations with the client up front and proactively communicating project concerns to team leadership and project sponsors
  • Plan and facilitate regular, recurring project touch points to ensure clients are providing quality, complete data within expected timelines to support best practice adoption and timely-go-live
  • Manage all pre-production stages of content (photo,video,3D) generation:
  • Work with client leasing teams to determine the scope of truva shoots at each property
  • Develop a shoot scheduling game plan across the client portfolio, taking into consideration building access, weather, space priority and content partner availability
  • Work with truva content partners to deploy 3D scan & video technicians on property
  • Confirm final content is attached to corresponding listings and ready for client review
  • Working to Scale:
  • Implement repeatable, automated data collection and onboarding processes that scale for the truva implementation team and support client outcomes
  • Optimize for automation where possible, while still reducing post-go-live data changes via implementation of a standardized UAT process
  • Document relevant implementation details (work-arounds where needed, etc) and client-specific workflows and best-practices for reference both by the client and ongoing support teams
  • Regularly reflect on and share project learnings with the implementation team with an eye for continuously improving processes to better serve our clients and team

What Makes You Awesome For This Role:

  • 1 + years of experience in the enterprise software space working directly with clients and partners to complete rollouts
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, experience with client-facing presentations and have a consistent record of working with senior leaders
  • You work with end-goals in mind and are excited about helping clients achieve their goals at all levels
  • You have a proven record of creating and maintaining project plans, monitoring open issues, and driving resolutions
  • You see problems are opportunities and are motivated to break down issues in order to implement solutions quickly
  • Comfortable with escalation management
  • You are able to build consultative relationships with client stakeholders at all levels and have working experience interacting with cross-functional teams
  • You are a master at change management - you guide others toward new behaviors through understanding and communication
  • Nice to haves:
  • Working experience with tracking systems such as JIRA and Zendesk
  • An understanding of how APIs work, SQL, and software troubleshooting

What VTS Values & How We Show It

  • Strive for Excellence - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
  • Be Customer Obsessed - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
  • Be Curious - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
  • Move as One - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
  • Take Ownership - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
  • Appreciate the Difference - VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!

VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Implementation Manager
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As an Implementation Manager, you will be joining the VTS Implementation Management team, responsible for ensuring the successful rollout of VTS - both data on-boarding and organizational change management - for our clients. We shape our clients’ first impressions using the VTS platform to power their businesses and strive to offer an excellent experience for every client.

You will be supporting both clients and internal teams with on-boarding customer data onto the VTS platform. As our company scales, the responsibilities outlined below may expand or evolve to adapt along with the VTS product suite and our clients’ increasing adoption of the platform across their businesses. Adapting your approach to support our clients’ needs over time will be paramount to success in this role. 


WHAT YOU'LL DO
- Be Client Success Driven: 
- Work cross-functionally across teams at VTS to ensure a consistent client experience from pre-sale through to implementation and ongoing support for each client
- Collaborate directly with professionals on the technical and business teams within each client to confirm goals driving implementation of VTS at their organization
- Own each client's success on the VTS platform by delivering the implementation plan with a strong focus on establishing technical integrations with client ERP systems
- Using a lens for long-term client success and data completeness within VTS,
- Review data structure and governance within external systems that will integrate with and automatically populate data fields within VTS 
- Ensure non-integrated data is collected and entered as part of implementation to support data continuity as the client adopts these new workflows
- Facilitate change management for business processes that will be managed within VTS after implementation through best practice documentation and training
- Be comfortable challenging clients on existing processes to help optimize them
  
- Run a Tight (Project) Ship:
- Plan, schedule, and manage project timeline and activities from project kick-off through training to ensure each project is delivered on time, within budget, and satisfies the desired outcomes of VTS implementation
- Plan and facilitate regular, recurring project management meetings to ensure the project is on schedule and client expectations are being managed accordingly
- Work with the client to mitigate project risks through clear expectation setting up front and continued review of the strategy as the project progresses
- Maintain detailed project plans to communicate project status both internally & externally 
- Proactively identify potential gaps & deltas client data and provide recommended best practices to achieve business outcomes
- Proactively identify project risks / blockers and collaborate with client project sponsors and implementation team leadership as needed to find solutions or workarounds to keep the project on target for time and scope
  
- Work to Scale:
- Document implementation details (integration specs, work-arounds where needed, etc) and client-specific workflows and best-practices for reference both by the client and ongoing support teams
- Documents should be re-usable across projects and templatized when possible to serve as a shared as a resource with the implementation team
- Regularly reflect on and share project learnings with the implementation team with an eye for continuously improving processes to better serve our clients and team
- Partner with other members on the implementation team to provide technical & data integrity support as needed


We Take Care of You! 
- Competitive compensation packages, including equity
- Great medical, vision, dental, and commuter benefits
- Fantastic location with easy walk to most major subway lines (Times SQ)
- Generous family policies
- Training and career development programs for everyone
- A company that embraces and celebrates diversity
- 401K plan
- Unlimited vacation policy
- Team lunches, company happy hours, ample snacks and drinks


#LI-EC1


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Lead Data Scientist
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.




How does this position help VTS succeed?
- As a leader within the data engineering team, you’ll help translate our vision of accelerating the way landlords and tenants plan, market, lease, and manage space. Reporting to the VP of Engineering, you will be the first Data Science hire for VTS and will help build and lead this team over the coming years. As such, you will:
- Define and monitor metrics, create data narratives, and build tools to drive decisions
- Build and interpret algorithms and machine learning models that power VTS’ data products
- Employ statistical tools to establish relationships
- Help design and build VTS’ next-generation data products and research reports that will leverage the power of our data sets
- Ensure our data sets are complete, unique, timely, valid, accurate, consistent, and easy to consume
- Work closely with engineers, product managers, designers, QA, and other business partners to discover and solve challenges for our customers
- Collaborate with other full-stack teams to incrementally craft high-quality products for our customers
- Have organization-wide impact through your work, departmental initiatives like brown bags and recruiting, being a mentor or onboarding buddy, etc.
- Stay current, publish, present, and contribute as a thought leader in the field of Machine / Deep Learning and AI


What makes you a great fit?
- You have a proven track record in data-driven innovation, problem-solving and building sophisticated products with complex, big data machine learning technologies
- You have hands-on skills with complex machine learning-based systems, multiple machine learning frameworks and techniques for optimal accuracy and performance in big production systems
- Experience designing and coding of algorithms to identify, categorize, prioritize, and process large volumes of unstructured data sets
- Strong experience writing high-quality and performant Python code in collaborative environments
- Hands-on experience with medium to large datasets (i.e. data extraction, cleaning, analysis, and presentation)
- Nice to have:
- Experience in Commercial Real Estate (CRE) data products and research
- Experience in full-stack development (Ruby on Rails and React)


More about our team
- We have a 70+ person engineering team
- We work in small, cross-functional teams that include product managers, designers, and QA, grouped in outcome-oriented “houses”
- We value continuous learning in our everyday work
- We deploy daily and rely heavily on automated testing and CI
- We use agile development and lean startup principles and practices to deliver products
- We work with technologies like Ruby on Rails, React, Heroku, Postgres, AWS, Swift, Android, Python, and Kafka
- Learn more on our [engineering blog](https://buildingvts.com/)


What VTS values & how we show it
- **Strive for Excellence - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!**
- **Be Customer Obsessed** - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!**
- **Move as One - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.**
- **Take Ownership - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.**
- **Appreciate the Difference -** VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Post Production Manager, truva
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help truva Succeed:

The truva Post-Production Manager is responsible for truva listing content (photos/video/3D) which is produced by various teams across the country.  Finalizing and funneling that content into the right places on truva.com is no easy task.  As part of a small but quickly growing team, the Post-Production Manager will act as The Gatekeeper for completed content making its way to building and listing pages on truva.com.  This role will also have the opportunity to interact with clients and content producers to continually improve our content offerings.



What Makes This Job Awesome:
- Coordinate and track incoming photo/video/3D content from content teams.
- Accept or ask for revisions from those teams when content is delivered.
- Manage and provide feedback to content teams, enabling them to continually provide higher quality content.
- When needed, complete edits for any of our content types for quick delivery to truva.
- Curate the final content to be posted live to truva listings.
- Accept incoming client content according to truva content guidelines.
- Analyze user behavior to see where content is succeeding, and where it needs improvement.
- Receive feedback from clients to better understand their content needs, and aggregate that feedback in order to adjust content strategy.
- Develop and manage custom workflows that can be shared across the truva team.
- Manage our near-term file/backup architecture, while designing our longer-term DAM implementation.
  


What Makes You Awesome For This Role:
- You are a post-production maestro.  You are one with Adobe CC (and other best-in-class tools) to polish off any kind of content.
- You love clean and streamlined processes, and are excited to do the research and testing to build out such processes
- You have a clear understanding for and are always looking to increase the “quality” of content, tweaking settings and pulling levers along the way.
- You are naturally empathetic to customer needs, and want to help deliver the product’s expected value.
- You always have a backup plan ready.
- You are constantly providing information needed to help others improve, offering feedback when needed.
  


What VTS Values & How We Show It
- **Strive for Excellence** - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
- **Be Customer Obsessed** - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious** - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
- **Move as One** - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
- **Take Ownership** - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
- **Appreciate the Difference** - VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

  • You are a post-production maestro. You are one with Adobe CC (and other best-in-class tools) to polish off any kind of content.
  • You love clean and streamlined processes, and are excited to do the research and testing to build out such processes
  • You have a clear understanding for and are always looking to increase the “quality” of content, tweaking settings and pulling levers along the way.
  • You are naturally empathetic to customer needs, and want to help deliver the product’s expected value.
  • You always have a backup plan ready.
  • You are constantly providing information needed to help others improve, offering feedback when needed.

What VTS Values & How We Show It

  • Strive for Excellence - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
  • Be Customer Obsessed - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
  • Be Curious - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
  • Move as One - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
  • Take Ownership - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
  • Appreciate the Difference - VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!

VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.




How does this position help VTS succeed?
- As part of the engineering team you’ll be a key contributor to our goal of accelerating the way space providers and occupiers plan, market, lease and manage space. As such, you will:
- Help design and build VTS’ next-generation APIs that will seamlessly integrate into our customer’s ecosystems
- Move VTS from a tightly-coupled data model to well-encapsulated sources-of-truth
- Ensure our data sets are complete, unique, timely, valid, accurate, consistent, and easy to consume
- Work closely with engineers, product managers, designers, QA, and other business partners to discover and solve challenges for our customers
- Collaborate with other full-stack teams to incrementally craft high quality products for our customers
- Have organization wide impact through your work, departmental initiatives like brown bags and recruiting, being a mentor or onboarding buddy, etc.


What makes you a great fit?
- You bring a holistic view to discussions around API design, looking at the impact and not just about delivering the functional needs
- Have built resilient, distributed data processing pipelines
- Extensive experience with different database technologies, both querying and modeling
- Experience with agile engineering practices (testing, continuous integration, etc.)
- The ability to work in a highly collaborative environment
- Strong customer empathy and a focus on quality


More about our team
- We have a 70+ person engineering team
- We work in small, cross-functional teams that include product managers, designers, and QA, grouped in outcome-oriented “houses”
- We value continuous learning in our everyday work
- We deploy daily and rely heavily on automated testing and CI
- We use agile development and lean startup principles and practices to deliver products
- We work with technologies like Ruby on Rails, React, Heroku, Postgres, AWS, Swift, Android, Python, and Kafka
- Learn more on our [engineering blog](https://buildingvts.com/)

jobs.title: Senior Data Visualization Designer
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help VTS Succeed:
The Senior Data Visualization Designer role at VTS comes with a high degree of responsibility and ownership over our data products, and enjoys the acclaim that comes with it. 

You will work in a cross-functional team of Product Design, Product Management, Engineering, and Data Science to unveil meaningful data insights that inspire our customers to make fast and accurate decisions for their business. 

You will analyze and glean insights from complex data sets, explore solutions and prototype them, and deliver cutting-edge data-driven experiences, and successfully translate these into intuitive designs and visualization. You must be quick to learn the CRE domain, collaborate well in cross-functional settings, and communicate inspirationally.


What Makes This Job Awesome:
- Design data products that work seamlessly together within our platform, accounting for larger application structure, hierarchy, and context, across all users and permissions.
- Employ research and analysis methodologies to build deep empathy for our customer motivations, goals, jobs to be done, and the larger systems in which they operate. 
- Proactively pitch ideas, and exhibit strong written and verbal communication skills, contributing design process and strategies to your squad and the Design and Data teams.
- Lead the design and application of ambitious data visualization patterns that greatly reduce redundancy and debt, factor high-impact aesthetic and functionality, and empower our customers to make the right business decisions.


What Makes You Awesome for The Design Team:
- Have a degree in Design, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
- Have prior experience as a Data Visualization Designer or as a Product Designer with an analytics focus.
- Have prior experience designing for complex enterprise applications with large data sets.
- Have a strong portfolio showcasing your best work and demonstrating process, usability principles, and research methodologies in data visualization and interaction design.
- Have clear and concise written and verbal communication skills, and ability to rationalize design decisions with Design and non-Design stakeholders alike.
- Bonus points for engineering ability to prototype rapidly using [D3.js](http://D3.js), and knowledge of Python and R.


What VTS Values & How We Show It:
- **Strive for Excellence -** We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
- **Be Customer Obsessed** - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious -** Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
- **Move as One** - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration. 
- **Take Ownership** - Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages. 
- **Appreciate the Difference -** VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


#LI-DK1


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Demand Generation (Contract)
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help VTS Succeed:

We’re looking for a high-performing demand generation expert to join our world-class Marketing team on a contract-to-hire basis. In this role, you’ll be responsible for leading the strategy, creation, and execution of integrative campaigns that drive pipeline and meet the aggressive revenue goals of VTS’ core software business. From digital to direct mail, you’ll deploy creative tactics across the entire buying cycle that drive demand and accelerate deals. 

Reporting into the Senior Director of Demand Generation, you’ll work amongst a talented team of high-performing marketers who are making a big impact at VTS. Expect to be set up for success starting on Day 1 — you’ll have access to best-in-class marketing tech and a solid budget to power your campaigns. 

This is the perfect opportunity for an experienced, results-driven marketer who’s looking to flex their strategic skillset and make a direct and measurable impact to the company’s bottom line. 

**This is a 6 month contract position**


What Makes This Job Awesome:
- Own creating pipeline for an entire segment of the VTS software business. You’ll be the marketing owner, working closely with Marketing leadership to develop and manage the execution of our demand generation strategy for VTS’ core software business
- Support Marketing and Sales leadership with quarterly pipeline forecasting and performance insights
- Manage marketing programs that manage the entire buying cycle, from acquisition to close, driving pipeline growth and improving pipeline velocity
- Create and execute end-to-end integrative campaigns across on and offline channels including advertising, email and direct mail
- Collaborate with Marketing Operations to continuously improve the health of our target contact and account database
- Measure and analyze program performance regularly, adjusting tactics as required to ensure results are achieved and goals are exceeded
- Work in partnership with the SDR manager and Sales leadership to maintain alignment through consistent reporting, feedback and campaign playbooks
- Participate in improving internal campaign production workflows — continuously recommend new technology and processes to improve campaign effectiveness and team efficiency 
- Measure and analyze program performance regularly, adjusting tactics as required to ensure results are achieved and goals are exceeded
  


What Makes You Awesome for The Demand Generation Team:
- 6+ years of B2B marketing experience in a demand generation role at a growing B2B SaaS organization
- Proven experience in leading both strategy and execution of ROI-based marketing programs
- Hands-on experience with account-based marketing strategies, tactics and tools
- Deep familiarity with Marketo and SFDC and ability to own marketing campaign automation
- Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze and report on program effectiveness and ROI
- Excellent project management, time management and organization skills
- Effective communicator with strong presentation skills
- Creative, out-of-the-box thinker
- Collaborative, flexible attitude — you thrive working in energizing, fast-paced environments
  


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We’re looking for a high-performing demand generation expert to join our world-class Marketing team on a contract-to-hire basis. In this role, you’ll be responsible for leading the strategy, creation, and execution of integrative campaigns that drive pipeline and meet the aggressive revenue goals of VTS’ core software business. From digital to direct mail, you’ll deploy creative tactics across the entire buying cycle that drive demand and accelerate deals.

Reporting into the Senior Director of Demand Generation, you’ll work amongst a talented team of high-performing marketers who are making a big impact at VTS. Expect to be set up for success starting on Day 1 — you’ll have access to best-in-class marketing tech and a solid budget to power your campaigns.

This is the perfect opportunity for an experienced, results-driven marketer who’s looking to flex their strategic skillset and make a direct and measurable impact to the company’s bottom line.

This is a 6 month contract position

What Makes This Job Awesome:

  • Own creating pipeline for an entire segment of the VTS software business. You’ll be the marketing owner, working closely with Marketing leadership to develop and manage the execution of our demand generation strategy for VTS’ core software business
  • Support Marketing and Sales leadership with quarterly pipeline forecasting and performance insights
  • Manage marketing programs that manage the entire buying cycle, from acquisition to close, driving pipeline growth and improving pipeline velocity
  • Create and execute end-to-end integrative campaigns across on and offline channels including advertising, email and direct mail
  • Collaborate with Marketing Operations to continuously improve the health of our target contact and account database
  • Measure and analyze program performance regularly, adjusting tactics as required to ensure results are achieved and goals are exceeded
  • Work in partnership with the SDR manager and Sales leadership to maintain alignment through consistent reporting, feedback and campaign playbooks
  • Participate in improving internal campaign production workflows — continuously recommend new technology and processes to improve campaign effectiveness and team efficiency
  • Measure and analyze program performance regularly, adjusting tactics as required to ensure results are achieved and goals are exceeded

What Makes You Awesome for The Demand Generation Team:

  • 6+ years of B2B marketing experience in a demand generation role at a growing B2B SaaS organization
  • Proven experience in leading both strategy and execution of ROI-based marketing programs
  • Hands-on experience with account-based marketing strategies, tactics and tools
  • Deep familiarity with Marketo and SFDC and ability to own marketing campaign automation
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze and report on program effectiveness and ROI
  • Excellent project management, time management and organization skills
  • Effective communicator with strong presentation skills
  • Creative, out-of-the-box thinker
  • Collaborative, flexible attitude — you thrive working in energizing, fast-paced environments

VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer -Data Insights-
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

How does this position help VTS succeed?

As part of the engineering team you’ll be a key contributor to our goal of accelerating the way space providers and occupiers plan, market, lease and manage space. 

As such, you will:
	- Work closely with engineers, product managers, designers, QA, and other business partners to discover and solve challenges for our customers
	- Collaborate with other engineers to incrementally craft high quality products for our customers
	- Have organization wide impact through your work, departmental initiatives like brown bags and recruiting, being a mentor or on boarding buddy, etc.
	- Directly contribute to exciting projects.

Examples of recent work:
			- Generate beautiful letters of intent (LOI) from financial terms managed in VTS
			- Rebuild our financial calculations to support new leasing metrics (e.g. net  effective rent), increase performance, and improve code quality
			- Automate infrastructure deployment using TerraformMigrate VTS workflow  front-end from Angular to React


What makes you a great fit?
- Demonstrable experience building web applications and APIs, and/or data products (data engineering, data visualization, machine learning)
- Experience with agile engineering practices (testing, continuous integration, etc.)
- The ability to work in a highly collaborative environment
- Strong customer empathy and a focus on quality


More about our team
- We have a 70+ person engineering teamWe work in small, cross-functional teams that include product managers, designers, and QA, grouped in outcome-oriented “houses”
- We value continuous learning in our everyday work
- We deploy daily and rely heavily on automated testing and CI
- We use agile development and lean startup principles and practices to deliver products
- We work with technologies like Ruby on Rails, React, Heroku, Postgres, AWS, Swift, Android, Python, and Kafka
- Learn more on our [engineering blog](https://buildingvts.com/)



- **Strive for Excellence -** We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
- **Be Customer Obsessed** - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious -** Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
- **Move as One -** We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
- **Take Ownership -** Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
- **Appreciate the Difference -** VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.description:

What This Position Does to Help VTS Succeed:

We are looking for engineers with a strong DevOps background to work with our team at Property Capsule to build and maintain monitorable, performant, reliable and highly-scalable software systems. 

Property Capsule is the leading marketing automation and prospecting software company for retail landlords and brokerages covering more than half of the top 100 retail landlords in North America. Our team has extensive experience with venture capitalist backed startups, with both successful IPOs and M&A in this $15T market. Current enterprise customers include many Fortune 500 and public companies. Offices are located in San Francisco and San Diego, California.


What Makes This Job Awesome:
- Evangelize best practices for building and operating highly reliable systems
- Serve as subject matter expert in observability and monitoring
- Consult in system design to meet reliability and capacity requirements
- Automate infrastructure and configuration management
- Conduct timely post-mortems of production infrastructure incidents
- Assist with all aspects of operational security and compliance
- Seek out potential threats to security and reliability and advocate solutions


What Makes You Awesome for Property Capsule and this role:
- Know when to triage and when to dive down into a root-cause analysis
- Passion for reliable, scalable, observable software with strong sense of ownership
- Experience developing and monitoring mission-critical systems
- Substantial experience with a programming language like Java, PHP or Python
- Experience with AWS


About our team:
- We work in small, cross-functional teams that include product managers, designers, and QA
- We value continuous learning in our everyday work
- We rely heavily on automated testing and CI
- We use agile development and lean startup principles and practices to deliver products
- Our stack: PHP, MySQL, Java, Angular 2, Postgres, AWS, CloudFormation, Swift
- Learn more on our [engineering blog](https://buildingvts.com/)


What VTS Values & How We Show It:
- **Strive for Excellence -** We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
- **Be Customer Obsessed** - We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
- **Be Curious -** Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
- **Move as One -** We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
- **Take Ownership -** Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.
- **Appreciate the Difference -** VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Senior Solutions Consultant, Data Team
jobs.description:
ABOUT VTS

VTS is the fastest-growing Proptech company in the history of commercial real estate (CRE). We have transformed a $15 trillion dollar industry with our award-winning platform which is used by more than 750 of the world’s leading landlords to manage their assets, tenants, and leasing processes.  We’re continuing to expand our product offerings and are building the industry’s first and only end-to-end leasing marketplace, truva.com.  Truva will enable landlords to market their available spaces more effectively, and help tenant rep brokers and their tenants easily find and lease space online – a process that has traditionally been offline and difficult.  

It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team – we recently reached unicorn status after raising $90 million in series D funding led by our clients (believed to be the largest venture financing in the history of commercial real estate software), we recently made the Forbes Cloud 100 list of the hottest private cloud companies, and were named one of  Crain's best places to work!

Our headquarters are in NYC, but we have hubs in other major US cities, Toronto, CA and London, UK.

Learn more at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.

What This Position Does to Help truva Succeed:

Solutions Consultants are key members of the Sales team, serving as product, technical and commercial real estate industry experts, aligning VTS solutions to prospects’ pain points and demonstrating how to achieve meaningful business outcomes using those solutions. Through partnerships with Customer Success, Product Management, Marketing and Sales, the Solutions team serves as a critical voice of the customer and develops unique solutions that help VTS’ customers transform their businesses. Solutions Analysts practice the art of the consultative sale, uncovering business needs and opportunities for process improvement and ROI, and validating the right solution for each customer through product demonstrations and proof of concept execution.

The Senior Solutions Analyst – Data Specialist has a particular focus on VTS’ data solutions and has three main priorities: 1) serve as an escalation point for the Solutions Consulting team on data-intensive opportunities, 2) helping our product team develop the best data products and solutions possible to serve the unique needs of VTS’ clients, and 3) educate and arm the broader Solutions Consulting and Sales teams with the tools they need to understand and position those solutions to our prospects and customers.




What Makes This Job Awesome:
- **Leveraging Business Acumen to Deeply Understand Customer Pain:**
- Rely on wealth of knowledge of how agency brokers use data to win, serve their clients’ needs and maintain and develop new relationships
- Ask the right questions to get at the heart of what customers need from data to make the right investment, leasing, and asset/portfolio management decisions
- Demonstrate knowledge of processes, procedures, roles, responsibilities and relationships in typical commercial real estate transactions involving leasing teams and brokers
- Need to be comfortable discussing the needs and challenges of the industry with C-level executives in high-pressure sales environments
- Maintain credibility as an expert in commercial real estate and in using data and insights to inform critical decisions
- Understand and articulate business pain, desired outcomes and capabilities across multiple stakeholder groups: practitioners, managers and C-Suite
- Assist Solutions Consultants in the discovery process to ensure understanding of the real problems to be solved for our customers
- **Delivering Solutions Using a Consultative, Customer-Oriented Approach:**
- Assist Solutions Consultants in capturing the right outcomes, capabilities and metrics that VTS data products can add to a broader VTS solution in a way that aligns with customer pain and critical KPIs
- Present VTS data products via sales pitches, product demonstrations and webinars in a way that tells a story about how VTS solves a customer’s real business problems
- Anticipate and overcome objections related to VTS and data products/solutions in order to increase win rate, decrease average deal time and increase deal size
- Influence decision criteria of prospective customers in VTS’ favor
- Assist Solutions Consultants in and take ownership of data-related proof of concept (POC) events
- **Educating & Evangelizing:**
- Serve as internal subject matter expert on all things data
- Teach broader Solutions and Sales teams about how data is used by landlords and agency brokers to gain competitive advantage to help them spot opportunities with which to align VTS solutions
- Serve as voice of the customer to Product and Engineering teams to help them develop and refine VTS data products and solutions
- Assist Product Marketing in developing messaging and sales collateral
- Develop and train Solutions team on delivering effective data solution demonstrations, and manage related demo environments


What Makes You Awesome For The Job:
- Bachelor’s degree
- 4+ years of full-time work experience in a customer-facing role as an analyst, associate or otherwise at an agency brokerage
- Experience incorporating industry and first-party data and insights into customer presentations, particularly in new business pitches
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially an ability to communicate technical/product value to a business audience
- Understanding of financial terms and calculations that drive commercial real estate decisions, including key financial measures (NER, NPV, etc.)
- Proven ability to deliver compelling and engaging presentations to key decision makers and executives
- Ability to quickly adapt in client meetings to position products based on key value drivers
- Strong problem-solving skills to identify, deliver and create best-fit solutions
- An intrinsic curiosity and desire to learn more – growth mindset
- Positive, team-first attitude
- Ability to travel up to 50%, as required and allowable
- **Bonus Points if:**
- Experience with CRE data systems
- Database/SQL experience
- Understands the dynamics of the CRE industry including the implication of different company types (CPs, LPs, REITs, Fund Managers, Developers, etc.)
  


VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
